verses.roman:
jñāna-mārge upāsaka--duita' prakāra
kevala brahmopāsaka, mokṣākāṅkṣī āra

synonyms: jñāna-mārge—on the path of philosophical speculation; upāsaka—worshipers; duita' prakāra—two varieties; kevala—only; brahma-upāsaka—the worshiper of impersonal Brahman; mokṣa-ākāṅkṣī—desiring liberation; āra—and.
translation: "There are two kinds of worshipers on the path of philosophical speculation-one is brahma-upāsaka, a worshiper of the impersonal Brahman, and the other is called mokṣākāṅkṣī, one who desires liberation.
